summary.p: As a thank you for Myconius' letter [18046 from February 29, 1548], Bullinger now sends him his writing [«Series et digestio temporum»], which he has written for a better understanding of the letters of the New Testament. May the little book be helpful to many and bring honor to Christ!
Otherwise, Bullinger has nothing to report. He has conveyed [Konrad] Wedenschwiler [the wish of his wife [N.N.] for a shared accommodation]. He intends to take care of it soon.
Various reports are circulating about Emperor Charles V. It is now claimed that his friendship with Pope Paul III has been restored. May the Lord protect his church!

Bullinger recommends the young letter carrier [Konrad Forrer?], who is coming to Basel as a Zurich scholar to study. Myconius should assist him with advice and support. Otherwise, he should not burden himself with him.

div.p: Greetings. I received your letter, my esteemed Myconius, and in return, I am now sending you the book. I have written it to aid the studies of those reading the sacred letters of the New Testament. May it benefit many and illuminate the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Furthermore, I have nothing else to write to you at the moment. I have carefully conveyed your wishes to Wedenschwiler. He responded that he will soon take care of everything properly.
Various reports are circulating about the Emperor. It is now also added that the friendship between him and the Antichrist is intact. May the Lord protect His church!

The bearer of this letter to you is a young man from Zurich and a scholar coming to Basel for the sake of his studies. I commend him to you. If he needs your advice and support, please assist him. Otherwise, I do not wish to burden you.
To Mr. Oswald Myconius, his dearest brother. In Basel.
